title: OpenCUA’s open source computer-use agents rival proprietary models from OpenAI and Anthropic
summary: The open source framework provides the data and training recipe for building powerful computer-use agents that challenge proprietary systems.

title: Meta is partnering with Midjourney and will license its technology for ‘future models and products’
summary: Details are scarce on how much if any money is involved. And what does it mean for Midjourney's previously announced plans for an enterprise API?

title: MCP-Universe benchmark shows GPT-5 fails more than half of real-world orchestration tasks
summary: A new benchmark from Salesforce research evaluates model and agentic performance on real-life enterprise tasks.

title: Don’t sleep on Cohere: Command A Reasoning, its first reasoning model, is built for enterprise customer service and more
summary: It looks to be a strong release. Benchmarks, technical specs, and early tests suggest the model delivers on flexibility, efficiency, and raw

title: Four big enterprise lessons from Walmart’s AI security: agentic risks, identity reboot, velocity with governance, and AI vs. AI defense
summary: Walmart CISO Jerry Geisler on securing agentic AI, modernizing identity, and Zero Trust for enterprise-scale cybersecurity resilience.

title: MIT report misunderstood: Shadow AI economy booms while headlines cry failure
summary: A new MIT report reveals that while 95% of corporate AI pilots fail, 90% of workers are quietly succeeding with personal AI tools, driving a hidden productivity boom.

title: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative’s rBio uses virtual cells to train AI, bypassing lab work
summary: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative unveils rBio, a groundbreaking AI model that simulates cell biology without lab experiments to accelerate drug discovery and disease research.

title: How AI ‘digital minds’ startup Delphi stopped drowning in user data and scaled up with Pinecone
summary: Delphi envisions millions of Digital Minds active across domains and audiences. Pinecone sees its database as the retrieval layer.

title: Enterprise Claude gets admin, compliance tools—just not unlimited usage
summary: Anthropic upgraded its Claude Enterprise and Team subscription to offer seats with access to Claude Code and offer additional admin controls.

title: TikTok parent company ByteDance releases new open source Seed-OSS-36B model with 512K token context
summary: One of the defining features is its native long-context capability, with a maximum length of 512,000 tokens, 2X OpenAI's GPT-5 family.

title: CodeSignal’s new AI tutoring app Cosmo wants to be the ‘Duolingo for job skills’
summary: CodeSignal Inc., the San Francisco-based skills assessment platform trusted by Netflix, Meta, and Capital One, launched Cosmo on Wednesday, a mobile learning application that transforms spare minutes into career-ready skills through artificial intelligence-powered micro-courses. The app represents a

title: Stop benchmarking in the lab: Inclusion Arena shows how LLMs perform in production
summary: Researchers from Inclusion AI and Ant Group proposed a new LLM leaderboard that takes its data from real, in-production apps.

title: LLMs generate ‘fluent nonsense’ when reasoning outside their training zone
summary: Chain-of-Thought isn't a plug-and-play solution. For developers, this research offers a blueprint for LLM testing and strategic fine-tuning.

title: DeepSeek V3.1 just dropped — and it might be the most powerful open AI yet
summary: China's DeepSeek has released a 685-billion parameter open-source AI model, DeepSeek V3.1, challenging OpenAI and Anthropic with breakthrough performance, hybrid reasoning, and zero-cost access on Hugging Face.

title: Alation says new query feature offers 30% accuracy boost, helping enterprises turn data catalogs into problem solvers
summary: Enterprise data catalogs are evolving into conversational AI agents that leverage metadata awareness to improve query accuracy.

title: Qwen-Image Edit gives Photoshop a run for its money with AI-powered text-to-image edits that work in seconds
summary: Qwen-Image-Edit caters to professionals who need control while remaining approachable for casual experimentation.

title: Keychain raises $30M and launches AI operating system for CPG manufacturers
summary: Keychain states it's currently being used by top CPG brands and food retailers including 7-Eleven, Whole Foods, and General Mills.

title: VB AI Impact Series: Can you really govern multi-agent AI?
summary: SAP'S Yaad Oren and Agilent's Raj Jampa discuss how to deploy agentic AI while staying inside cost, latency, and compliance guardrails.
